Case reference: 2014006304.CaseDesc: Richard Gaida left his hometown of Martensville, Saskatchewan for Kelowna, British Columbia at the end of September, 2012.  Richard was in the Kelowna area to work, however, Richard has not been seen or heard from since September, 2012 when he was last in contact with family and co-workers.

Case reference: 2014003922.CaseDesc: On Saturday July 15, 1972, Mr. Zukewhich and a friend took a canoe on to Clearwater Lake. Witnesses state that both men were under the influence of alcohol and that they took alcohol with them into the canoe. Witnesses further noted that the lake was extremely rough due to high winds. Mr. Zukewhich and friend were seen departing around 1600 hrs heading towards an area known as Long Point. A resident of Long Point advised police he observed one person in the red canoe which was sitting flat indicating weight in the front. The canoe was recovered on July 17th. Despite extensive searching, Mr. Zukewhich was never located.

Case reference: 2018040713.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1996, at approximately 7:30am, William Chan was last seen when he dropped off his son at school in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Ski coat; Brand-North Face

Case reference: 2014001392.CaseDesc: On March 31, 1994, Kuldip Singh was seen for the last time in Brampton, Ontario.  There is a possibility that Mr. Singh may be in the United States.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2014006454.CaseDesc: Jonathan Jay Wood was last seen in November 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014006282.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2012, a relative of Jean Marc Lavallée called the Roussillon Inter-municipal police to check on Mr. Lavallée at his residence in La Prairie, Québec, as they were worried about him. The police found that Mr. Lavallée was not at his residence, and his vehicle was not in the parking lot. The police took numerous steps to locate Mr. Lavallée, but he remains missing. He was seen for the last time on November 25, 2012.

Case reference: 1999000026.CaseDesc: On Oct 15, 1997, Jami Furnandiz was last seen in the town of Port Perry, Ontario, after dropping her child off to day care. She was scheduled to attend school in the area but did not show up and has not been seen since. Jami Furnandiz frequented the Oshawa downtown and was known to hitchhike by means of traveling between cities.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, red heart with arrow through it

Case reference: 2014002297.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1983, Dean Martin was seen for the last time at a cottage on Mount Carleton in Carleton-sur-Mer, Quebec. He left the cottage without leaving a note or informing anyone. Dean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003036.CaseDesc: Originally from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Regan Pace Ambrose is believed to have gone missing in Japan. After being recruited to work at a Japanese hospital, Miss Ambrose moved to Tokuyama, Yamaguchi, Japan. She was last seen on January 11, 1998 after finishing a shift at work. She was reportedly seen in the area of Mount Aso in Kumamoto, Kyushu Japan on January 10th, 1998. Japanese and Canadian authorities investigated; however, met with negative results.

Case reference: 2018063868.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2018, Apu Akbar was last seen by his roommates at his home in St. John’s, Newfoundland. Apu's grey Honda Civic was located on November 8, 2018, in the area of Kavanagh’s Lane and Windgap Road in Flatrock, Newfoundland. The keys were still in the ignition and his cellphone was found in the vehicle. Apu is originally from Bangladesh.

Case reference: 2015050387.CaseDesc: Linda Normandin was last seen leaving a shelter in Longueuil on September 3, 2015. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2023064175.CaseDesc: Hao Luo, better known as Helen to her family and friends, left her home in the community of Glenwood in Winnipeg, Manitoba, on November 22, 2023. Helen was feeling despondent at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006007699.CaseDesc: Kelvin Norris left his residence on November 27, 1984 at about 11:00 pm, he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2024001138.CaseDesc: Michael Walker left his friend's home in Norland, Ontario, following a weekend party on November 5, 2023. He was thought to be returning to his father's home, which is located 15 minutes east of the small hamlet of Kinmount, Ontario. On November 6, 2023, Michael's father discovered Michael's vehicle parked in his driveway, open and without keys. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006011699.CaseDesc: Justin Pollari is from St. Joseph Island, Ontario, and was last seen on Friday, December 7, 2001. He is known to be an avid skateboarder and may frequent areas where this sport is practised.

Hair: Blonde, Sometimes worn in a "Mohawk" style
Jewelry: Wood, Nametag with the inscription of "Woody"

Case reference: 2013000113.CaseDesc: Lana Derrick was given a ride from Houston, BC where she was going to college, to Terrace where she was dropped off at a friend's house.  Ms. Derrick spent the evening with friends hanging out in the Terrace downtown core.  In the early morning hours of October 7, 1995, Ms. Derrick picked up $30 from a friend's house and was last seen at the Copperside Foods/Petro Canada in Thornhill.  Her family reported her missing three days later when she did not show up for Thanksgiving dinner.

Case reference: 2014003073.CaseDesc: Michael Hammond was last seen on November 24, 1991 at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005502.CaseDesc: Pinaskin Ottawa was last seen shopping on October 11, 2010, around 11:00 AM at the Atikamekw Community Grocery Store in Manawan. Since then, several investigations have been conducted in the vicinity of Manawan without success. He has not been seen or heard from since

Case reference: 2014004707.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1986, Paul Leduc was going to the family cottage at Lake Duhamel in the Saint Jovite, Mont Tremblant area. He has not been seen since. His vehicle and personal belongings were found at the cottage. His canoe containing paddles and a life jacket was found adrift on the lake near the cottage.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2022015231.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2022, Kyle Brocklebank was seen for the last time walking in the area of Thirty Road, in the town of Smithville, Ontario.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 1992003440.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1984, Daniel Worobec, 18 years old, was last seen in Lanigan, SK. A witness stated that Mr. Worobec told him he was waiting for a ride. Searches and investigation have failed to locate Mr. Worobec

Boots: Brown, cowboy boots with square toes
Hat: Blue, White, ball cap with writing on it

Case reference: 2020015197.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Tony Noskey was seen for the last time as he was riding a four-wheel all-terrain vehicle with his friends near the community of Cadotte Lake in Alberta. During the course of this outing, Tony had disappeared into the bush, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005431.CaseDesc: Mahendiran Ratnasingam last spoke with his ex-wife on June 8th, 2006, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006023499.CaseDesc: Viola Panacheese was last seen on August 18, 1991 walking on Lakeshore Avenue in Sioux Lookout, Ontario.  Ms. Panacheese wears glasses but was not wearing them at the time of her disappearance.

Scar: Right Shin, burn scar from knee to ankle

Case reference: 2017021635.CaseDesc: Kevin Sadownyk was last seen on April 24, 2017 in Okotoks, Alberta. Kevin’s truck was found abandoned just outside of Banff, Alberta the next day. Kevin was reported missing by his family and has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Spray Gun and text "RHYS Kolby"

Case reference: 2016052152.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2016 at approximately 9:30 p.m., John Casey was seen for the last time aboard a cruise vessel in transit between Cap-aux-Meules and Havre Saint-Pierre, Quebec. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016046700.CaseDesc: Mr. LADD was last seen on August 18, 2016, by his daughter at his residence where he prepared them dinner.  Mr. LADD stated he needed to run out for a while and did not return.

Case reference: 2017045266.CaseDesc: On August 7, 2017, James Candy was reported missing from his residence north of Lavoy, Alberta. James was last seen in his bedroom the night before on August 6, 2017 at approximately 11:00 pm.

Case reference: 2006020899.CaseDesc: Pooran Shivcharan, age 36, was last seen in an aircraft heading west bound in the direction of Geraldton, Ontario on November 13, 1981. Although he was originally headed toward Thunder Bay, he may have altered his course towards Geraldton or Raith.  Search efforts were unable to locate Mr. Shivcharan or his aircraft.

Case reference: 2017056443.CaseDesc: Kristina Ward is a 20 years old aboriginal female who has been missing since September 27, 2017. Kristina is schizophrenic and is possibly using drugs. Kristina is developmentally delayed and is described as being vulnerable and easily trust people she does not know.  Kristina has money and a cellphone, however, neither have been used or accessed since September 27, 2017. Kristina was last seen in Surrey at the intersection of 104th Avenue and 144th St. with an unidentified male.

Mark: Upper Lip, Birthmark on upper left lip

Case reference: 2023048947.CaseDesc: Autumn Dillon was last seen in September of 2023 in Lloydminster, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014001255.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1979, Robert Caldicott last spoke with his father on the telephone. Mr. Caldicott failed to attend several appointments in the following days.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000066.CaseDesc: Jean Corbeil was last seen on May 25, 1977 in Montreal, Quebec. Jean left his home in the De Lorimier district and was never seen or heard from since.

Sweater: Beige, with "USA Army" on the front

Case reference: 2012020046.CaseDesc: On January, 17, 2008, Bradley Worobeck left his place of employment in downtown Calgary and went to a pub that was also in downtown Calgary. That was the last time anyone saw or heard from Bradley.

Case reference: 2021015236.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2018, a woman believed to be Nerissa Cox was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York. During the time of her disappearance, Nerissa was despondent.

Pierce: Ears, Multiple piercings on both ears
Tattoo: Right Hand, Possibly letters on fingers
Left Hand, Possibly letters on fingers
Right Side Of Neck, Block letters possibly "Boricua"

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard, Quebec on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Jian Ping Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, her credit card, her cell phone, money, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2014006037.CaseDesc: On March 21, 2013, Bruno Pouliot went to a medical appointment. Later that evening, Bruno was last seen in a pharmacy located in Saint-Pierre-de-l’île-d’Orléans, Québec. Bruno lived in the Donnacona area and was known to go snowshoeing on the frozen St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2021015656.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2017, Ann Victor-Lazarus was seen for the last time as she left her home to go to church. Ann’s vehicle was found in a parking lot near the “Parking Authority Water Intakes” on the Niagara River Parkway in Niagara Falls, New York State. Her personal belongings, as well as a note, were found in her vehicle. Ann was captured on video surveillance near the railing of the waterway.

Case reference: 2014003128.CaseDesc: Olimpia Mikszan was last seen on the morning of June 21, 1996, outside her residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  She was living alone in a rental suite.  Her vehicle and nearly all of her personal belongings were left at her residence.  Olimpia had just completed high school.  Olimpia was born in Poland, speaks fluent Polish and has a slight Polish accent when speaking English.

Case reference: 2006022499.CaseDesc: Witold Sagin was last seen while fishing on Gordon Lake. He was fishing in a canoe, which was later found overturned. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014006302.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2013, Gaetan Ethier was last seen when he was on a ferry crossing the Ottawa River towards Quebec. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2009001399.CaseDesc: Calvin Vanness was last seen on March 26, 2008 at approximately 2:30 PM in the Quinte Mall parking lot in Belleville, Ontario. He last spoke to his family to make plans to meet later that day. When he failed to meet them, his family attempted to locate him, then reported him missing on March 31, 2008. His car was located on April 1, 2008 at the Highway 38 car park in Kingston, Ontario. He was known to carry large sums of money and some cannabis. Mr. Vanness has not accessed any of his bank accounts since his disappearance.

Case reference: 2005001499.CaseDesc: Lois was last seen shortly before midnight at the Village of Lucknow reunion dance on July 3, 1988. She left there and returned to her residence in Kincardine, Ontario where she resided alone. The police investigation indicates Lois was going through her usual evening routine before retiring. Lois, described as a devoted family person and a dedicated worker, failed to report for work on July 4, 1988. Her friends and family became concerned and notified police that she was missing.

Case reference: 2014002857.CaseDesc: Colin Campbell was last seen March 12, 1998. Mr.Campbell was seen jumping off the Reversing Falls Bridge in Saint John, NB. His body has not been recovered.

Case reference: 2014004965.CaseDesc: Cecilia Nikal arrived in Vancouver to visit her mother on August 1, 1989; she then left her mother's house to live on the streets. She was last seen by her mother in October of 1989. A report by a family member that Ms. Nikal had subsequently moved to Vancouver Island was never confirmed.

Case reference: 2012020087.CaseDesc: James Carlson was last seen between 7:00 p.m. and 8:00 p.m. on 5 May 2010 at a local business in Watrous, Saskatchewan. His 1985 Chevrolet Monte Carlo was found nearly 125 kilometres north in a rural area south of Rosthern Sk. Police have yet to locate James.

Hair: Brown, Balding in front , longer in back
Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing Left upper front tooth

Case reference: 2014001139.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1974, the skeletal remains of a teenage boy were discovered under a log near Lost Lagoon in Stanley Park, Vancouver, British Columbia. He was believed to have died at least a year before his discovery.

Pants: Corduroy, Dark Blue, Button fly pants
Sweater: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Turtleneck, Knitted turtleneck sweater

Case reference: 2020040144.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1950, Mabel Crumback was seen for the last time at approximately 12:30 am at her home located in Toronto, Ontario. Mabel had been babysitting her younger brother while her family was out of town. The following morning, she was gone.

Case reference: 2014005046.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2007, at approximately 3:45 p.m., Remi Bouchard was seen for the last time on a floatation device in the Bow River near Calgary, Alberta. Remi disappeared into the water after being trapped at the base of the weir.

Case reference: 2016060096.CaseDesc: Conrad Roderick Jason Ducharme was reported missing on October 25, 2016, by family members who had not heard from or seen him in two months. Conrad was last known by family to be hitch hiking to a meeting in Dixonville, Alberta in July 2016. He was last seen in Manning, Alberta, in early September 2016.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014006426.CaseDesc: Sara Coates was last seen in the Stanley Park area in Calgary, Alberta. Ms. Coates was leading a nomadic lifestyle, living out of her van with her dog and 3 cats, travelling around Alberta and BC. Ms. Coates’ van was located October 22, 2013, in a secluded area of Morley, Alberta. It appeared to have been there for some time. Police investigations regarding Ms. Coates’ whereabouts are ongoing.

Scar: 2 small surgical scars on inner groin

Case reference: 2006014099.CaseDesc: Lee Kerton was reported missing when he failed to return from a fishing trip on September 17, 1977, on Wakomata Lake in Ontario, Casson Township.

Case reference: 2018016267.CaseDesc: Yvette Bourgon was seen for the last time on approximately March 1, 1966 in Montreal, Quebec.  Yvette was hospitalized at Louis-H Lafontaine, formerly known as St-Jean-de-Dieu. Yvette's footprints were found in the snow near the Lachine Canal in Verdun, Quebec. Her purse was found without her wallet in close proximity to the footprints.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2019068219.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2019, Marshal Iwaasa was last seen by his family in Lethbridge, Alberta. During this time, Marshal had told his family that he was returning to Calgary, Alberta. On November 23, his burnt vehicle was recovered at the end of Phelix Creek Forest Service Road, in a remote area near the Birkenhead Lake Provincial Park in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003594.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1984, Pamela Asprey was last seen getting into a vehicle near the National War Memorial in St. John’s, Newfoundland. The male driver was described as having a large build and wore a baseball hat. That evening, Ms. Asprey had gone to a bar near where she was last seen. She had left her wallet at the bar and had advised her friend that she would be back in twenty minutes. Pamela was known to frequent the Duckwork Street area in St. John’s.

Tattoo: Shoulders, Greek writing on right shoulder

Case reference: 2008004499.CaseDesc: Paul Lanteigne was last seen on July 19, 1990. He telephoned his wife on July 20 to advise her he was leaving Cranberry Marina at 6:00 p.m. to return to the Dyconia Hotel in Wasaga Beach in his boat. The boat was recovered overturned in Georgian Bay, and a search was conducted. Grey deck shoes belonging to Mr. Lanteigne were found on the beach on July 21, 1990, but nothing else was recovered.

Case reference: 2014001755.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1982, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Howard Dobie was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Montreal, Quebec. Howard had left without saying where he was going. At the time of his disappearance, Howard was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2019010720.CaseDesc: Patrick Comeau was last seen on November 13, 2017, in Montreal, Quebec. Patrick has been known to frequent the downtown Montreal area.

Case reference: 2020008878.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1979, Joseph Vetere was seen for the last time in the area of 1061, Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, A penny with the initials "T.W."
Left Upper Arm, Bear on a rock

Case reference: 2021047956.CaseDesc: Gerald Smith was last seen in July 2021 in Whitemouth, Manitoba when it was believed he left alone on a fishing trip. At the time of his disappearance, Smith was discouraged following a medical diagnosis.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Elbow, Metal pins and plates

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2014004087.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1996, James Withers was last seen at his family's residence.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2014002923.CaseDesc: On March 27, 1998 Jacqueline Olynyk was observed to be walking by the Red River in Winnipeg, MB.  Miss Olynyk has not been heard from or seen since that day.

Case reference: 2006004699.CaseDesc: On 13 July 1992, William Aman left the shore of Lake Ontario to go fishing.  His boat was later found with his ball cap 3.2 kilometers off of Pete's Point, Lake Ontario. Mr. Aman has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002090.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2000, Stephane Levesque was seen for the last time at his home in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Stephane went to move his car from one side of the street to the other, and he never came back.

Coat: Black, Winter coat with Skidoo written in yellow

Case reference: 2014001622.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 1982, Clayton Mark Bussiere was last seen while driving his taxi cab on Lougheed Highway (Highway 7) in Mission, British Columbia. Mr. Bussiere's taxi cab, a 1978 blue Pontiac Lemans, has never been located. It is unclear as to whether or not Mr. Bussiere had a passenger at the time of his disappearance.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Saint Christopher Medal necklace
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace up shoes; brand: Downunders
Sweater: Grey, Zippered Cardigan with Elbow Patches

Case reference: 2014004550.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2004, David Creaser was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta.

Tattoo: Shoulders, TIGER ON ONE SIDE, DRAGON ON THE OTHER

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014001721.CaseDesc: On April 7, 2003, Luis Betancourt was seen for the last time when he left his home in St. Catharines, Ontario. His abandoned vehicle was later found in Niagara Falls. At the time of his disappearance, Luis was despondent and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006019499.CaseDesc: David Block was reported missing from Swastika, Ontario. He had been seen in Newfoundland in 1994.  Mr. Block suffered from mental health issues that could bring him to the attention of authorities. He was last seen in Washington D.C., U.S.A, on May 1, 1995.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Straight, Dyed, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2021000674.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Tyler Desorcy was seen for the last time in the 900 block of Pandora Avenue in Victoria, British Columbia. Tyler has no fixed address and he has not been seen or heard from by his family, which is out of character for him.  Tyler is known to walk with a notable limp.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown receeding hair with some facial hair

Case reference: 2023041781.CaseDesc: On or about March 21, 2018 Daniel Chambers was last seen in the area of Niagara Falls, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 1989125890.CaseDesc: Jeffrey was taken by a couple driving a 1979-80 blue chevy truck.

Shirt: Beige, Brown, T-SHIRT, Long sleeve - brown trim

Case reference: 2014006340.CaseDesc: Anatoli Dibrov left his home in Winnipeg, Manitoba for around 30 minutes in the evening on January 16th, 2002. He appeared secretive when he returned home. Anatoli went to bed that evening and was never seen again. He may have returned to his birthplace of Russia. Anatoli is not fluent in English, but does speak Russian, Polish, and Ukrainian.

Boots: Brown, Red, Reddish/brown with red fur trim (only available in Russia)
Gloves: Brown, Grey, Brown mittens or grey gloves

Case reference: 2019044701.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2019, at approximately 6:00 am, Bridget Dalbe was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005279.CaseDesc: Brian Guberman was reported missing in July 1974. Brian owned a black and yellow 1964 Volkswagon van that has never been located.

Case reference: 2012020003.CaseDesc: Kelly Rideout was reported missing to Chilliwack RCMP on August 28, 2011.  She is believed to have lived a high risk life style and her disappearance is suspicious.  Police believe that Miss Rideout was the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2008019699.CaseDesc: On April 10, 2006 Mohmud Jiwani left his residence in Oakville to attend a business meeting in Toronto. He never returned to his Oakville residence. His vehicle was later located in the Jarvis and Dundas area of Toronto. Despite an extensive investigation, no further information has been uncovered regarding his disappearance.

Pants: Dark Blue, Navy blue suit pants

Case reference: 2012020122.CaseDesc: Robert Bishara was last seen during the evening of March 17th, 2009 in Brossard, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, he was driving a black 2006 Chevrolet Trailblazer 2006 bearing Quebec licence plate 941TBA. The car has not been located. Robert originates from Egypt and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2018009360.CaseDesc: On February 18, 1987, George Christie was last seen at the intersection of Broadview Avenue and Queen Street East in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001192.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1983, the partial remains of a young adult male were found on the south side of Cracroft Island. He was partially clothed in a wetsuit, and may have been out fishing when he went missing. The last joint of the little finger on his left hand was amputated. He is estimated to have gone missing sometime in 1982 or 1983.

Pants: Cloth, Gold, Small sweatpants with drawstring waist
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Little Finger, Amputation of left pinky finger

Case reference: 2024011240.CaseDesc: Melanie Lapish was last seen on February 26, 2024, in the town of Fort Frances, Ontario. Melanie has ties to the Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario area.

Tattoo: Lower Back, Tribal tattoo with butterfly, black and white, 102 mm (4 inches)

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2014002760.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1976, a witness saw Claude Houle fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. His body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2020011478.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1988, Mary McCarthy was seen for the last time at her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Mary’s vehicle was later found on November 17, 1988 at the bus depot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mary was a chartered accountant working for CSA Management Ltd. at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes
